channel.title: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop
channel.description: Ok currently I have an old Dell Latitude CP laptop http://support.dell.com/support/edocs/systems/pmojav/specs.htm with 128mb of ram (maxiumum) windows 2000 actually runs extremely well with a boot time of about 15 seconds and office and iexplorer are pretty fast also. The problem is....I have no use for this on an older laptop because I have a couple of new computers which do the same thing better with new software. So the question is what practical use can an old laptop be made into. I was thinking about detaching the screen and using it for something but its much more complicated than that.

item.title: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:10, topic:337915”]Make a laser with the hard drive.[/quote]say wut?

you could actually make a speaker out of the hd, i did it once. you can make the armature (or watever its called) oscillate.

Read full topic

item.title: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Well I tried Damn Small Linux, and it works (okay) a bit slower than Windows 2000 but far more useless. I don’t have internet and the browser takes forever to load. Windows 2000 browser would load instant and I had Office 2003 but now im screwed. So instead I just used nLite to strip down Xp and im going to try installing it.

Read full topic

item.title: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

It has a wireless-g card in the slot (forgot what its called). I was thinking about FreeNAS but because the USB is only USB 1.0 that wouldnt work out very well so I like the idea of the emulator.

Read full topic

item.title: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

does it have a modem? if so, you could use it for automatic telemarketing, like what homer does on the simpsons and gets all those free dollars through the post.

Read full topic
item.source: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop

item.title: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:337915”]I cannot see an ethernet port so if that USB port is USB 2.0, you could hook that up to your router somehow either by cable (which is preferable but only if your router supports it) or using a wireless dongle. Clean whole hard-drive, do a clean install of any linux distro without no shitting gui. Run a home webserver or even ircd on it. If possible, you could even attach an external hard drive!

If the usb port is shit or you can’t hook it up to your network, you might be able to run a nes emulator on it and you could hook it up to your tv.[/quote]

Run an emulator, hook it up to the tv? No, no, no, no. You run an emulator on it, build simple joystick/parrallel adapter for one, put it in a case.

Read full topic
item.source: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop

item.title: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I cannot see an ethernet port so if that USB port is USB 2.0, you could hook that up to your router somehow either by cable (which is preferable but only if your router supports it) or using a wireless dongle. Clean whole hard-drive, do a clean install of any linux distro without no shitting gui. Run a home webserver or even ircd on it. If possible, you could even attach an external hard drive!

If the usb port is shit or you can’t hook it up to your network, you might be able to run a nes emulator on it and you could hook it up to your tv.

Read full topic
item.source: What to do with a very, very, very old laptop
